critique: This document establishes the President's Economic Policy Board and outlines its structure, membership, and responsibilities. It aims to centralize and coordinate economic policy decision-making within the executive branch. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or impacts on civil liberties. The order seems to expand executive power by creating a new board to advise the President and coordinate economic policy. It also centralizes economic policy at the federal level. There's a moderate level of government intervention implied by the creation of this board. There is no indication of social inclusion or exclusion.
